account_types.savings: A savings account is a basic type of bank account that allows you to deposit money, keep it safe, and withdraw funds, all while earning interest. Features include: minimum balance requirements, interest rates, online banking access, and ATM facilities.
account_types.checking: A checking account is a deposit account that allows you to easily access your money for daily transactions. Features include: unlimited transactions, check writing privileges, debit card access, and online bill payments.
account_types.fixed_deposit: A fixed deposit is an investment instrument offered by banks which provides investors a higher rate of interest than a regular savings account. Features include: fixed interest rates, flexible tenures, and premature withdrawal options.
account_types.current: A current account is primarily for business transactions. Features include: no interest on deposits, unlimited transactions, overdraft facility, and business banking services.
account_types.salary: A salary account is a type of savings account where your salary gets credited. Features include: zero balance maintenance, free ATM transactions, and special offers for salary account holders.

loan_types.personal: A personal loan is an unsecured loan that can be used for any purpose. Features include: fixed interest rates, flexible repayment tenures, and quick disbursement. Eligibility depends on credit score and income.
loan_types.home: A home loan is a secured loan taken to purchase a property. Features include: long repayment tenure, tax benefits, and flexible EMI options. The property serves as collateral.
loan_types.car: A car loan is a secured loan taken to purchase a vehicle. Features include: competitive interest rates, quick processing, and insurance coverage. The vehicle serves as collateral.
loan_types.education: An education loan helps finance higher education. Features include: moratorium period, tax benefits, and no collateral requirement for smaller amounts.
loan_types.business: A business loan helps finance business needs. Features include: flexible repayment options, quick processing, and no collateral requirement for smaller amounts.

cards.credit: A credit card allows you to borrow money up to a certain limit. Features include: reward points, cashback offers, interest-free period, and EMI conversion options.
cards.debit: A debit card allows you to spend money by drawing on funds you have deposited. Features include: ATM withdrawals, online shopping, and contactless payments.
cards.prepaid: A prepaid card is loaded with money in advance. Features include: controlled spending, online shopping, and no credit check requirement.
cards.business: A business credit card is designed for business expenses. Features include: expense tracking, employee cards, and business rewards.

services.online_banking: Online banking allows you to access your accounts and perform transactions through the internet. Features include: fund transfers, bill payments, and account management.
services.mobile_banking: Mobile banking provides banking services through a mobile app. Features include: quick transfers, mobile recharges, and QR code payments.
services.atm: ATMs provide 24/7 access to banking services. Features include: cash withdrawals, balance inquiries, and fund transfers.
services.cheque: Cheques are a secure way to make payments. Features include: post-dated cheques, demand drafts, and multi-city cheques.

terms.interest_rate: Interest rate is the percentage charged on loans or paid on deposits. Types include: fixed rate, floating rate, and reducing balance rate.
terms.emi: EMI (Equated Monthly Installment) is the fixed payment amount made by a borrower to a lender. It includes both principal and interest components.
terms.credit_score: A credit score is a numerical representation of your creditworthiness. It affects loan eligibility and interest rates.
terms.kyc: KYC (Know Your Customer) is the process of verifying customer identity. Required documents include: ID proof, address proof, and photograph.
